dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: TINTIN and HADDOCK race out of the THEATER!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Captain, Sakharine’s got the scroll!

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: It's worse than that!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: (horrified) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: They took your scroll Tintin - it's gone!  9. TINTIN skids to a HALT... approaching SHOUTS...

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: How?! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: It was Allan, he, he knobbled me in the, in the garden. There was a bottle of alcohol... TINTIN cuts him off, disappointment written all over his face.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: There always is.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: No, no. No, not like that - HADDOCK puts his hands on TINTIN’s shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: I can smell it on you. TINTIN pushes HADDOCK's hands off, and heads out. EXT. BELOW DAM, BAGGHAR STREETS — DAY ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE pulls out the THREE SCROLLS from his JACKET POCKET - it is the first time we have seen all thr together. SAKHARINE’S FALCON sits on the corner of the windshield of the JEEP! SAKHARINE smiles smugly drops the THREE SCROLLS into the LEATHER WALLET.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: Hurry! Back to the boat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINTIN punches a GUARD, who falls to the GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: HADDOCK desperately runs out of the palace

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Tintin! HADDOCK joins TINTIN...  96.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: I'm going after Sakharine!

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: By yourself?

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Yes. Come on, Snowy. HADDOCK considers his options. He turns back and grabs the GUARD’S WEAPON: a ROCKET LAUNCHER, from the ground. A GUARD is starting to stand up, as HADDOCK swings the LAUNCHER over his shoulder and turns, he knocks out the G back to the ground. HADDOCK walks over to the motorcycle, TINTIN kicks in the engine. BEN SALAAD runs out of the palace.

dialogues.speaker: BEN SALAAD
dialogues.text: Get them, get them! ANGLE ON: TINTIN rockets across the BRIDGE, riding a MOTORCYCLE, with HADDOCK and SNOWY in a SIDECAR. EXT. BELOW DAM, BAGGHAR STREETS — DAY TINTIN’s reflection is in the rearview mirror of the JEEP TOM looks back. ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE glances behind him - his face sets in HARD MASK when he sees TINTIN.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: Loge them! Get him off our tail! ANGLE ON: ALLAN begins firing on the MOTORCYCLE. SNOWY hides in the SIDECAR from the gunfire. HADDOCK swings the ROCKET LAUNCHER onto his SHOULDER ... HADDOCK squeezes the TRIGGER... BOOM! The ROCKET LAUNCHER fires backward - straight into the DAM CONTROL STATION! ANGLE ON: HADDOCK looks back, trying to SPOT where the RO HIT... he can sees A CLOUD OF SMOKE rising.  97.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Did you hit anything?

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Oh, dear, HADDOCK throws down the ROCKET LAUNCHER. The WALL of the DAM bursts with a THUNDEROUS BOOM! ANGLE ON: TINTIN and HADDOCK desperately attempt to outru the wall of mud in the motorcycle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE as he watches the DELUGE behind TINTI and HADDOCK.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: Faster, you idiot, faster! TINTIN skillfully navigates the MOTORCYCLE, as TOM desperately steers the JEEP down flooded streets. ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE looking behind them ... SAKHARINE POV: a TORRENT of MUD is BEARING DOWN on them! TINTIN'S MOTORCYCLE is getting closer! TINTIN and HADDOCK drive past on motorbike with sidecar . SNOWY LEAPS into the JEEP and tries to grabs the SCROLLS. SAKHARINE tries to keep them from SNOWY, only to have the SCROLLS grabbed by TINTIN. SNOWY JUMPS BACK TO THE MOTORCYCLE.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Devil!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: I’1l have those, thank you!

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Come on, Snowy! Come on! Incoming falcon at 4 o'clock! SAKHARINE's FALCON flies after TINTIN and HADDOCK... he swoops down! The MUDSLIDE slams into the city BUILDINGS, destroying everything in its path.  98. A TANK bursts through the WALL behind them and HADDOCK is banged on the head by the BARREL. HADDOCK’S COAT is snagg by the TANK CANNON and he is lifted from the SIDECAR.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tintin, faster! The scrolls slip from TINTIN'’s hand - HADDOCK grabs two.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: The scrolls!

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Got one! Two! SNOWY grabs the SCROLL before it flutters away.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: And three! The MOTORCYCLE breaks in two, and TINTIN and SNOWY sail o in different directions!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Snowy! HADDOCK hangs from BARREL of TANK... the TANK careens and slides all over the road, smashing HADDOCK from one wall another. HADDOCK hangs precariously over the edge of a drop... HADDOCK falls through lines of washing... HADDOCK loses another SCROLL which flutters up into the a The SCROLL flutters in the air, HADDOCK tries to grab it.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Oh, no - oh no! Not again! Come here, my beauty! The FALCON swoops in and snatches the SCROLL... HADDOCK g chase, cursing as he goes! HADDOCK (CONT’D) Ten thousand thundering typhoons! Come here, you pilfering parakeet! TINTIN collects HADDOCK on the front of his MOTORBIKE.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Captain, the bird - grab it!

SNOWY rides atop the MUDSLIDE and manages to capture the FALCON, pinning him down with the SCROLL still in his BEA They RACE alongside TINTIN and HADDOCK. TINTIN (CONT’D) Nice work, Snowy - don‘t let him go! HADDOCK launces himself at the FALCON ... he manages to u SNOWY and the BIRD - they fly through the air into a BUILDING, as SNOWY hangs on by his TEETH to the SCROLL th FALCON holds in hia TALONS! HADDOCK ends up inaide the building ... he swirls around around as the MUD RISES HIGHER ..-

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Hang on, Snowy! Snowy, I’m coming! HADDOCK grabs SNOWY. Winded, SNOWY lets go of the SCROLL. The FALCON snatches the SCROLL ... SAKHARINE arrives in the JEEP ...

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: There he is! There he is, stop! Stop!! He raises his arm to the bird. SAKHARINE (CONT‘D) That's right. That’s right, come to daddy! Come to daddy ... TINTIN intercepts the FALCON!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Got you!

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: No, wait! He grabs the bird and manages to get two of the SCROLLS before the FALCON escapes!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: No!! As SAKHARINE pursues TINTIN, HADDOCK bears down on SAKHAR and his HENCHMEN.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: Come on, quickly! Quickly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geronimo! HADDOCK lands on the JEEP!

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You double-dealing, pilfering parasites!

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: Keep your eye on the boy! HADDOCK thumps ALLAN, ALLAN tries to fight back. TINTIN chases the FALCON through the collapsing BUILDING nearly manages to capture it after it becomes entangled i LOOM. The FALCON breaks free and the chase continues!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Excuse me! Pardon me! Sorry! The MOTORCYCLE is smashed on a bridge, and TINTIN uses th HANDLEBARS to ride ELECTRICAL WIRES like a ZIPLINE. He ru along the WALLS of BUILDINGS, SMASHES into POLES and ride LANTERN after the FALCON, the THREADS that still entangle bird just beyond his grasp! Juet as the FALCON loses TINTIN, he jumps from a BALCONY grabs the FALCON.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got you!

dialogues.speaker: ALLAN
dialogues.text: There he is! TIME SLOWS as TINTIN slowly aligns the SCROLLS, still loc in the TALONS of the FALCON. The mysterious SYMBOLS slowl become NUMBERS.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: The scrolls are lining up. These are hidden numbers. SAKHARINE observes TINTIN from nearby.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What does it say? TINTIN’s moment of discovery is interrupted by SAKHARINE.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t do that if I were you!  TOM and ALLAN hold HADDOCK over the edge of a nearby BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: SARBARINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let the bird go. What do you value more, those scrolls or Haddock's life?

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Agh! Don’t listen to him! You'll never get away with this, you sour— faced sassonack!

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: I will kill him! TINTIN refusea to release the FALCON.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Bon't worry about me, Tintin, I’m fine!

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: Let the bird go now or this man dies! ALLAN and TOM prepare to throw HADDOCK into the water.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: No, wait!

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: (to SAKHARINE) You two-timing troglodyte! You simpering son of a po~face profiteer.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should put it to the test. Here's mud in your eye! ALLAN and TOM throw HADDOCK into the MUD!

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Fat head! TINTIN releases the FALCON and dives in after him! The FA flies to SAKHARINE’S ARM.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: The TANK finishes dragging the HOTEL BAGGHAR to harbor before falling into the water. THOMPSON and THOMSO emerge on the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: We're saved!

dialogues.speaker: THOMSON
dialogues.text: I love the beach.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: You gaid you wanted a holiday!

dialogues.speaker: THOMSON
dialogues.text: Quite. The MANAGER of the HOTEL comes out and places a STARFISH his SIGN to add a fourth star to the hotel’s three. ANGLE ON: The KARABOUDJAN STEAMS AWAY from the BAY. HADDO is watching it LEAVE.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: (furious outrage) Nobody takea my ship! ANGLE ON: HADDOCK turns to TINTIN for support, but finds TINTIN just sitting, looking defeated.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: They've already taken it.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Nobody takes my ship twice!

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (energized) We'll show them, eh, won't we, Tintin? Alright then - what’s the plan?

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: There is no plan.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Of course there's a plan - you always gotta have a plan.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Not this time.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HADDOCK looks at TINTIN expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Sakharine has the scrolls. They‘1l lead him to the treasure... it could be anywhere in the world. We'll never see him again. TINTIN shakes his head. TINTIN (CONT’D) It’s over.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: I thought you were an optimist!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Well, you were wrong, weren‘t you? I'ma realist.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: That’s just another name for a quitter.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: You can call me what you like. Don’t you get it? We failed.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Failed? There are plenty of others willing to call you a failure, a fool, a loser, a hopeless souse! But don’t you ever say it of yourself! HADDOCK pokes TINTIN in the chest and he falls back into chair. HADDOCK looks at TINTIN a beat.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You send out the wrong signal, that is what people pick up. Do you understand? You care about something, you fight for it. You hit a wall, you push through it. There's something you need to know about failure, Tintin... HADDOCK turns and walks away from TINTIN. TINTIN looks up HADDOCK. HADDOCK turns and looks at the KARABOUDJAN leavi HADDOCK (CONT’D) You can never let it defeat you.  104. TINTIN plays back what he hae just heard. He looks up. An suddenly we know we've reached a TURNING POINT.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: What did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: You hit a wall, you push through it?

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: No, no, no, you said something about sending out a signal! TINTIN slaps one hand with the other.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (explaining) Of course! Captain, I sent a radio message from the Karaboudjan. I know what radio frequency they‘re transmitting on.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Well, how does that help us?

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: All we have to do is send that information to Interpol. They can track the signals and figure out which way they’re headed. The THOM(P)SONS appear in the distance, walking along the beach towards them.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: (delighted) Here comes Interpol now.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSONS
dialogues.text: Tintin!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Any port they enter, we'll know at once. HADDOCK’S eyes sweep round the harbour and settle on the SEAPLANE that is moored there.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: We can get there first!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON: A BUSY EUROPEAN DOCKLAND. CRANES stand like skel DINOSAURS, RAILWAY TRACKS run up the length of WHARFS, wh many SHIPS are MOORED. ANGLE ON: The KARABOUDJAN pulls into DOCK. SAKHARINE comes STRIDING down the GANGWAY, TOM and ALLAN behind him. STANDING next to a stately BENTLEY CAR, waiting for them, NESTOR in a CHAUFFEUR’S UNIFORM.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What are we doing here, boss? I don't get it. We’re right back where we started.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: You’re to speak of this to no one. Keep your mouths shut.

dialogues.speaker: ALLAN
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. As long as we get our share.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: Oh, you'll get your share. Just guard the ship. SAKHARINE brandishes the three SCROLLS.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: But where are you going? (beat) Where's the filthy moulah? SAKHARINE exchanges a glance with ALLAN. He understands ALLAN'S worry. SAKHARINE walks toward his waiting CAR, where NESTOR is standing.

dialogues.speaker: NESTOR
dialogues.text: Good evening, sir. I trust you had a successful trip abroad?

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: (rudely) Do I pay you to talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering under his breath) You don’t pay me at all. ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE slides into the CAR. SUDDENLY, CHAINS lift on either side of the CAR! Before SAKHARINE can react, the car starts rising into th air! WIDE ON: The CAR is being lifted by one of the huge WHARF

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: What the blazes? Nestor, Nestor! ALLAN and TOM come out of the SHIP with their GUNS drawn. They look up and see the CAR moving TOWARD TEE CRANE! SAKHARINE (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING
dialogues.text: ALLAN and TOM just stand and watch. ANGLE ON: HADDOCK in the CAB of the CRANE, pulling LEVERS HADDOCK drives the CRANE forward and SWING THE CAR to the of the ROOF of a BUILDING, where TINTIN stands with the THOM(P)SON TWINS.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: Caught him like a rat in a trap!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Congratulations, gentlemen. He's all yours.

dialogues.speaker: THOMSON
dialogues.text: Yes! We also have an arrest warrant issued by both Interpol and the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: Your friend who got shot...

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Barnaby! ?  107.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: One of their agents. Hot on Sakharine‘s trail from the start.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: It still doesn’t make any sense. He has the key to the treasure of the Unicorn, which is sitting somewhere on the ocean floor. Why would he come back home? ANGLE ON: The CAR swings over and lands in front of the waiting group; they approach the CAR. ANGLE ON: HADDOCK laughs from his CRANE as they approach. THOMPSON steps forward and pulls open the back door... th back is EMPTY!

dialogues.speaker: THOMSON
dialogues.text: Right. THOMPSON (CONT‘D) THOMSON Sakharine? Sakharine? SILENCE. SAKHARINE sits up in the driver seat.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: That's Mr. Sakharine to you! SAKHARINE pulls a GUN and keeps them at gunpoint; the oth slowly back away. SAKHARINE (CONT’D) Hold it! The GUN goes off, the BULLET shattering a WINDOW. HADDOCK tries to WRESTLE IT F HIS GRIP. SAKHARINE (CONT’D) What's going... ?  108. HADDOCK and ALLAN in the CRANE CAB. ALLAN pushes HADDOCK the SIDE DOOR, and he hangs precariously from a RAILING. ALLAN runs to the controls and raises the CRANE, lifting SAKHARHINE and the CAR into the air.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Allan! Allan! Get me down, get me down, man! ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE in the CAR as it is SWUNG AWAY from t BUILDING on the PALLET.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not that way! Not that way, you fool, the other way! HADDOCK sneaks in behind ALLAN, throws him from the ROOM, ALLAN lands in the BED of a PASSING TRUCK. He takes a sea the CRANE CONTROLS. SAKHARINE jumpa out of the CAR and into the cab of SECOND CRANE. ANGLE ON: SAKHARINE takes a seat in the SECOND CRANE. He struggles with the CONTROLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAKHARINE and HADDOCK jump into action, and the CRANES approach each other and COLLIDE! HADDOCK and SAKHARINE duel, as the MASSIVE METAL ARMS of CRANES violently SLAM into each other. TINTIN and the THOM(P)SONS dive to safety as SAKHARINE’S CRANE ARM swing just over their heads. SAKHARINE then uses the arm to thr PALETTE of CEMENT BAGS into HADDOCK’S CAB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HADDOCK fights to clear the CAB of the DUST and DEBRIS; t ARM of SAKHARINE’S CRANE crashes into the front window of CAB. ANGLE ON: A POLICE CAR is split in two by a CRANE. HADDOCK slams his CRANE ARM onto the SAKHARINE'S CABIN, ripping away the ROOF!

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: Close, but no cigar!  109. SAKHARINE knocks out the SUPPORTS of HADDOCK’S CRANE with PALETTE of BOXES. HADDOCK hits his head on the CABIN ROOF BOXES and CRATES rain down on TINTIN, SNOWY and the TWINS TOM runs at them with a GUN, but is trapped as several TI land on him. A group of THUGS rush to TOM’S aid, but SNOW opens a CRATE of CANS that trip them up! HADDOCK charges with his CRANE; SAKHARINE and HADDOCK are face to face.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: (deadly) Red Rackham!

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: That’s right, my ancestor. Just as Sir Francis was yours.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: (grim) Unfinished business.

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: I‘m glad you know the truth, Haddock. Until you could remember, killing you wouldn't have been this much fun! SAKHARINE’S CRANE slides backward, the ARM SWINGS WILDLY knocks HADDOCK'S CRANE over! ANGLE ON: TINTIN watches as HADDOCK’S CRANE falls. HADDOCK’S CRANE lands on the DECK of the KARABOUDJAN; he tumbles out of the cabin with other debris from the CRANE SAKHARINE walks down the ARM of the CRANE toward HADDOCK.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Who gave you permission to board my ship?!

dialogues.speaker: SAKHARINE
dialogues.text: I don't need it. SAKHARINE pulls a SWORD from his CANE. SAKHARINE (CONT‘’D) I’ve never needed it. As HADDOCK stands, he grabs a METAL LEVER off the GROUND.  110. SUDDENLY, TINTIN swings in and retrieves the scrolls from

dialogues.text: Thundering typhoons. Nobody takes my ship. HADDOCK punches SAKHARINE in the FACE, sending off the sh railing! HADDOCK kicks the last BOTTLE of WHISKEY after h It hits SAKHARINE on the head.  111. TINTIN looks up and locks eyes with HADDOCK, he sees a ne man.

dialogues.text: THE THOM(P)SON TWINS pull SAKHARINE out of the water, and throw him down on the DECK of the POLICE LONGBOAT.

dialogues.speaker: THOMSON
dialogues.text: We have you now, you devil. You are under arrest!

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: To be precise... you are under arrest. SAKHARINE puts his hands up in defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINTIN holds the SCROLLS up, allowing the SUN to SHINE through them.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Do you see? CLOSE ON: A row of NUMBERS and LETTERS along the bottom o the SCROLLS.

dialogues.text: It took all three scrolls to form the numbers.

dialogues.text: Latitude and longitude ... that is it! That’s the location of the treasure! TINTIN reaches out his hand, but HADDOCK grab him and the a celebratory dance. HADDOCK laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: We did it!  112.

dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The WIND rushes through SNOWY's fur, and then TINTIN'S COIF. HADDOCK raises a SEXTANT to his eye, check location against the position of the sun. Puffy clouds to above, and we assume he’s at sea.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Almost there, Mister Tintin. A nudge to starboard should do it. CLOSE ON: TINTIN... low angle, looking up towards the SKY WIND blasting his HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Are you sure we're on course?

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Aye, trust me, laddie - I know these parts like the back of my hand! WIDE ON: HADDOCK is standing on the passenger seat of a c TINTIN behind the wheel. HADDOCK (CONT’D) Starboard! Quickly! Quickly!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Aye, Captain - starboard it is... They go off the road and drive through hedges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come through the clearing and arrive at the front st of MARLINSPIKE HALL.

dialogues.speaker: FULL STOP
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: TINTIN looking up at the exterior of the large mansion.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marlinspike Hall!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Those coordinates lead here. This is where Sir Francis hid it? (puzzled) I thought the treasure went down with the ship...  113. ANGLE ON: NESTOR opens the front door and welcomes HADDOC and TINTIN.

dialogues.speaker: NESTOR
dialogues.text: Master Haddock, Mister Tintin, I've been expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: HADDOCK steps inside the GRAND HALL.

dialogues.speaker: NESTOR
dialogues.text: Welcome to Marlinspike Hall.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Would you look at this place! I don’t think it’s changed at all since I was a wee boy.

dialogues.speaker: NESTOR
dialogues.text: And may I say, Sir, how much I am looking forward to having a Haddock back in charge of the estate.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: You'll be waiting a long time, Nestor. (wistful) There’s no way I could afford to live here.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Well, Captain, you know the house. Where do we start? HADDOCK thinks a moment ...

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Is the cellar still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: NESTOR leads HADDOCK and TINTIN down the STAIRS inte a DIM VAULTED CELLAR... HADDOCK looks around in CONFUSION.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no, no, no, this isn’t it. I meant the other cellar.  114.

dialogues.speaker: NESTOR
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, sir - there is no other cellar.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: It was bigger than this... ANGLE ON: SNOWY runs away and suddenly DISAPPEARS!

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Snowy! Snowy, where are you? TINTIN moves over to the other side of the room, there ia wall with furniture all stacked up. The GUARD DOG is look around trying to get to the other side. TINTIN looks around and sees an opening. TINTIN (CONT‘D) Captain, help me. HADDOCK AND TINTIN start to remove the furniture. ANGLE ON: TINTIN finds a small hole in the brick wall. TINTIN AND HADDOCK LOOK AT EACH OTHER. SNOWY is on the other side. TINTIN (CONT’D) Snowy. Just like you said, Captain. You hit a wall...

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: ++. you push through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: BOOM! TINTIN and HADDOCK using an OLD LUMP OF W as a BATTERING RAM! They SMASH it against the BRICKS, PUNCHING a larger HOLE in the BRICK WALL. ANGLE ON: TINTIN climbs through the wall into a LONG VAUL ROOM, lit with filtered LIGHT beaming down from DUSTY SKYLIGHTS ... the ROOM is FULL of ANTIQUES, old SUITS of ARMOR, PAINTINGS, STATUES.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: My Grandfather must've walled it up before he lost the house. TINTIN and HADDOCK hurry along the ROWS of ANTIQUES ... TINTIN looks to the STATUE of a BEARDED MAN holding a CRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tee 115.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: And then shines forth, the Eagle's Cross...

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: I can see the cross but where's the eagle?

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: St. John the Evangelist, who was always depicted with an eagle, and he’s called the Eagle of Patmos. He is the eagle. {at the statue) But what is he trying to tell us, Captain? I’m at a loss. A CARVED, STONE GLOBE. HADDOCK leans close to study The GLOBE has detailed islands and coastloands in raised relief. HADDOCK traces an ARCHIPELAGO of TINY ISLANDS.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: That island, the one in the middle, that doesn’t exist.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Because I’ve sailed those waters countless times. I've been there. It's a mistake. TINTIN; an idea is forming in his mind.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: What if it isn’t... ? HADDOCK looks at TINTIN, intrigued...

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir Francis wanted his inheritance to go to a man who was worthy of it... a man like himself, who knows the seas like the back of his hand. A man who could look at a globe and tell if one tiny island was out of place. HADDOCK takes TINTIN's meaning. He leans forward and slow presses the TINY ISLAND that shouldn't be there...  CLICK!! The top of the GLOBE pops open, like a lid! TINTIN and HADDOCK lean forward, peering into the GLOBE.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: (quiet awe) Blistering treasure! It’a Red Rackham's barnacles! TINTIN dips his hand in and brings out a HANDFUL of TREAS HADDOCK (CONT’D) What's this? HADDOCK lifts out the lining containing the rest of the TREASURE and chuckles. He recognizes that it is SIR FRANC HAT. He empties the contents of the HAT into another container, and proudly puts it on. TINTIN pulls a SECOND PIECE OF PARCHMENT from the GLOBE. INT, SECRET CELLAR, MARLINSPIKE — DAY NESTOR arrives, carrying a tray with a BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGN and GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: BADDOCK
dialogues.text: Bh hah! It's just a wee tipple - a toast to our good fortune! (drinks ) Oh, that’s better! It's odd really... you'd would of thought after all the fuss and bother, there would've been more ... HADDOCK drinks TINTIN’s glass.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: More of what?

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Red Rackham's treasure! I mean, by your own account he looted half of South America! I just thought... ach, never mind. There‘s plenty to go around. (sighs) Oh, it’s a funny old life, eh? Well, you've got your story for your newspaper. - all's well that ends well. NESTOR leaves.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: It’s not ended. ANGLE ON: TINTIN holds up a PARCHMENT MAP.

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir Francis left another clue at the bottom of the globe.

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: A clue to what?

dialogues.speaker: TINTIN
dialogues.text: Four hundred weight of gold just lying at the bottom of the sea. HADDOCK and TINTIN exchange a look. TINTIN (CONT’D) How’s your thirst for adventure, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: HADDOCK
dialogues.text: Unquenchable, Tintin! TINTIN and HADDOCK stare at the map together. The CAMERA ZOOMS in on SNOWY. He BARKS, almost like he is saying, “O no, not again... help!" TITLE CARD: AND THE ADVENTURE CONTINUES ...
